CategorysText.physical: Attack that reduces the enemy's health by dealing physical damage with a base power of {power}. It will lose power based on the enemy's physical defense.
CategorysText.special: Attack that reduces the enemy's health by dealing special damage with a base power of {power}. It will lose power based on the enemy's special defense.
CategorysText.support: It does not affect the enemy's health directly. Instead, it causes different effects such as improving stats (adding {base} permanent points per use up to a maximum of {maxLayer} uses while not leaving combat) or recovering health (+{heal}).

text: Neutral is neither weak nor strong against any element (only available for attacks).
Creatures can learn attacks of their type, of the Neutral type, and of the type they are weak against:
Using an attack of the same type as the creature casting it deals extra damage.
If the creature receiving the attack is weak against the attack type it takes extra damage, but if the creature is strong against the attack type it takes reduced damage.
Reduces the target's health, increasing damage based on the physical attack of the creature making the attack and reducing damage based on the physical defense of the creature receiving the attack.
Reduces the target's health, increasing damage based on the special attack of the creature making the attack and reducing damage based on the special defense of the creature receiving the attack.
• Stat Boost: Permanent boost (until fainted or changed) to a specific stat. All stats have their assigned boost attack except for maximum HP. Multiple layers of the same boost can be stacked.
• Healing: Regenerates a fixed amount of health per use.
The buff for using attacks of the same type as the casting creature also applies to support attacks.
• Max Life: Maximum amount of hit points the fully healed creature can have.
• Speed: Determines which creature attacks first during combat.
• Physical Attack: Determines the power of Physical attacks.
• Special Attack: Determines the power of Special attacks.
• Physical Defense: Determines the damage reduction of received Physical attacks.
• Special Defense: Determines the damage reduction of received Special attacks.
Each Elemental type has two related stats:
This relationship between stats and types is used to help determine the color of creatures and to decide how to assign the types of each stat's Support attacks.
All creatures have the same amount of total stats, but their distribution is random.
The image that represents the creature depends on its main stat (the highest one) or main stats if it has multiple stats with values close to the main one.
The overall color depends on the type (Red, Green, Blue), but the tone (lighter or darker) depends on the type-related statistic that stands out the most as being higher or lower.
Type is not influenced by stat distribution so related stats may not be any of the main stats.
Every 10 rounds a shop will appear where you can exchange the accumulated coins for creatures.
A small fee can be paid to change the available creatures.
At any time you can consult the information about the creatures before purchasing them.
Purchased creatures can be added to your team, or you can get one of their attacks and teach it to a creature on your team.
As long as you have enough coins you can buy as many creatures as you want until you decide to leave the store.
